result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kiara M Lathrop

defendant.name: Lathrop, Kiara M

records.addlTxt: Detainer placed at: Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility - Detainer was emailed to facility due to the facility having fax issues.

1:26 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Kiara M Lathrop appeared by Zoom, in custody.  Attorney Priya Barnes appeared by Zoom for Kiara M Lathrop. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Attorney Barnes requests an arraignment date before the Trial Court as she would like to speak with her client about a speedy trial demand.
The Court will adjourn the matter to the Trial Court.
THE DEFENDANT IS CURRENTLY INCARCERATED AT MSDF, HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.
Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant returned copy of summons filed by District Attorney office.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Kohls listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:39 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Kiara M Lathrop appeared by Zoom, in custody.  Attorney Priya Barnes appeared by Zoom for Kiara M Lathrop. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Barnes is appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM MSDF FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
